title.narrative: STRENGTHENED PREVENTION AND RESPONSE SERVICES TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE

description.narrative: By 2023, prevention and response services to address violence and discrimination against children are strengthened in targeted sectors., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, all boys and girls, without discrimination, are better protected from all forms of violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation.

participating-org.narrative: UNESCO FOR GULF COUNTRIES AND YEMEN

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls
Family reunification in emergencies - prevention and response
Inter-sectoral coordination and collaboration on violence, exploitation and abuse
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

Saudi Arabia (Gulf Area subregional programme) Country Programme Document 2019-2023
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

related-activity.ref: 3780/A0/07/002 CHILD PROTECTION FROM VIOLENCE, ABUSE AND EXPLOITATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, prevention and response services to address violence and discrimination against children are strengthened in targeted sectors.

description.narrative: UAE, KSA, and Qatar cultivated partnerships and carried out a range of assessment to improve the child protection system. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: Country has a national, multi-sectoral plan(s) or strategy(ies) for coordinated action to prevent and respond to violence against children that meets key criteria for quality, according to status of plan.
